name: Days Inn Hotel New York City - Broadway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a budget hotel, and while it has its flaws, it was convenient to seeing Manhattan and we got a good night's sleep every night.
reviews.title: Does the basics well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: The hotel is on 94th Street, a few steps off of Broadway. There's an entrance to the subway in front of the bodega ("94th Street Blueberry Farm") across 94th from the hotel. Most of the prime tourist action is around Times Square, which you'd take a downtown train to get there. You have two choices: if you pick the express side of the platform, you're there in two stops, and it's very convenient. If you pick the local side, you'll still get there, but you will stop every couple of blocks. Pretty much every subway line connects at Times Square and that gets you anywhere in the city, so once you remember to take the express train to Times Square, you'll love this hotel and understand why they say that they're close to all the action.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Surrounding Neighborhood: You're blocks from Central Park, so if the weather is nice, grab your camera and take a walk. Turn left out of the hotel. You'll cross Amsterdam, Columbus, and then you'll be at Central Park West and the park will be across the street. We entered the park at 96th and Central Park West and found ourselves in the North Meadow, which is used for youth soccer games. There's also jogging trails, a nice children's playground, and benches to sit down and take a break. There are some nice places to eat off of Amsterdam, and some friendly pubs to grab a drink that are reasonably priced. One of New York's iconic deli's, Barney Greengrass, is within walking distance. It's not cheap, but if you want a real Jewish deli and not a "concept" restaurant, it's worth walking over for breakfast or lunch. (You'll also find a cheaper deli on Broadway with a good breakfast if you turn right out of the hotel and walk about a block past the Duane Reade.) If you grow tired of paying too much for a hamburger around Times Square and want to spend an evening living like a local, you're staying in a pretty nice residential neighborhood, so you have the option of hanging out with New Yorkers.
reviews.title: Great place to stay at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself: As with most New York hotels, the building is old and the elevators are tiny and slow. (I found the same size elevator at the Marriott East Side. The difference is that the Marriott's elevator looks nice inside and the Days Inn looks like someone went to Home Depot, grabbed some cheap plastic that you might use to line a bathroom wall and lined the elevator with it.) The carpet needs to be replaced. If you're in a room across from the ice machine (we were) you're going to hear noise. However, the important basic stuff is A-OK. The bed was comfortable, the pillows were thick and supportive, and hot water was never a problem. There is free WiFi. I couldn't get my phone to connect to the WiFi, but I did see people in the lobby with their laptops, so it did work for some people. There is a business center where you can pay by the minute to use a computer. You will pay for all phone calls, even 800 numbers. There is a tour desk where they'll hook you up with sightseeing or airport shuttles, although I opted to skip that because I've been to the city enough to know where I'm going (or use HopStop to tell me how to get there).
reviews.title: If you can... pay for a better place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we got a great night's sleep every night, and while we were underwhelmed when we first walked in, we had a great trip and really couldn't complain about the hotel and would consider staying here again.
reviews.title: Clean, but dated, not as close to Times Square as stated but safe area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for one week and it was just awful! There were cockroaches in our room and we were on the 12th floor! The place must have been plagued with the things. I even found one floating in the coffee! The staff were unhelpful and the lifts were awful. Calling it the Quality Hotel is a complete farce. Fawlty Towers would be more apt. It reminded us of some cruddy Youth Hostel in a third world country. It ruined our visit to New York and we couldn't wait to leave and go home. It is, without any doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I would gladly have paid more to stay in something decent but that will teach me to trust a travel agent, never again! I agree with the person who said take your tent and put it up in Central Park, you'll be much more comfortable!
reviews.title: Don't stay at this Hotel

reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was scared of coming here. However,my room ( smoking - eleventh floor) although small, was clean and comfortable. I had a good kingsize bed,
reviews.title: clean and comfortable
not good, not good at all
reviews.text: and the bathroom was clean and functional.The elevator was slow and clunky,but it got
me to my floor.The subway was only across the street.The service at the front desk was affable enough.I got this hotel on Hotwire, and I would certaily give this hotel another try/
reviews.title: Extremly Convenient

reviews.text: We went there and read their notice about how "everything works" when nothing in our room worked..the toliet didn't even flush! so we told the very unhelpful staff who didn't get anything done till the third time we asked them. By then it was our last night and still had many problems with other broken things in the room. In addition they need to sort out their heating systems..
reviews.title: Great location, near subway, diner and drug store

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights and was great. Room was on the 5th floor. Room and separate living room and bedroom. Room was larger that what I expected. Very clean room. 2 TVs, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. Bathroom connected with the bedroom. Furniture were in decent condition. Carpet and flooring very clean. View wasn't that great...but that was ok. Friendly front desk. Housekeeping excellent. I would come back and stay. Great diner next to the hotel...a must see...
reviews.title: Enjoyed my first trip to NYC

reviews.text: This hotel is one of those "only in New York" kind of places; barely adequate, generally.
reviews.title: though like a wanderer . . . darkness be over me . . . my rest a stone

reviews.text: Room was clean - refrigerator worked; bathroom OK - had a nice view north to the
reviews.title: Worse hotel I have ever stayed at! A HORRIBLE experience :(

reviews.text: east end of the nave and the crossing of Cathedral of St. John the Divine.
reviews.title: stop complaining

reviews.text: There were safety issues, however. Door on street is open ALL NIGHT 24/7. ANYONE
reviews.title: Has had better 'days'

reviews.text: I have been travelling in hotels in NY and ended up staying here as all other hotels in Manhattan were sold out. One of the worst hotels ever - the room that I got could not be located as there were no signs for the rooms. Finally, I had to go down and the manager told me that the room was located in the staircase area. Terrible, smelly rooms, rickety lifts - they claimed to have free wireless but it was so slow that it was good as useless. No provision for breakfast either - for the money I spent, I would never stay here again.
reviews.title: Worst hotel I have stayed in NY

reviews.text: The rooms were spacious, but the carpeting and furnishings had seen better "days." Inexpensive and located within a block of the subway. Some of the elevators were being repaired the entire time we were there, which meant we had to wait 15 minutes or more for an elevator. The only complaint is that we had to go into the hall to get a decent WiFi signal. That was a nuisance. The hotel next door has a stronger signal. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Convenient location... great value.

reviews.text: My first review on trip advisor. Just wanted to warn about this hotel. I was woken up at 4AM with bedbug bites and observed the bedbugs in my bed. Room was also rather dingy and dirty. Not a great place to stay.
reviews.title: bedbugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, if you are booking this hotel and expecting 4-5 star luxury, then book the Sheraton, Hilton or whatever other hotel. It is NOT even close! If you are looking for a inexpensive place to sleep that is comfortable enough, then this is the place for you. The bed was comfortable, the room clean enough, bathroom space was adequate. Subway within walking distance. Plenty of places to grab a bite. Duane Reed right downstairs. Would I recommend it to someone, sure but I would warn that this is a no frills hotel that does the job of a nights sleep. Would I stay there again, no, only because I would rather stay in Times Square!
reviews.title: It's ok!

reviews.text: We went for 4 days we have no complains, just the soda machine at my 4th floor was not working but its many places to get drinks & more. Room very neat ,clean & big bathroom. Subway Station at the corner, also a pharmacy downstairs.
reviews.title: Neat Place to Stay
